text: In Greek mythology, Aegialeus (Ancient Greek: Αἰγιαλεύς derived from αἰγιαλός aigialos "beach, sea-shore") also Aegealeus, Aigialeus, Egialeus, was the name of several individuals: * Aegialeus (King of Sicyon), one of the sons of the river god Inachus.Pausanias, Description of Greece 2.5.6 * Aegialeus (King of Argos), elder son of Adrastus, a king of Argos.Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 1.9.13 * Aegialeus, an alternative name given by some scholars for Absyrtus, the son of Aeëtes who was murdered by Medea.Diodorus Siculus, Bibliotheca historica 4.45 == Notes == == References == * Diodorus Siculus, The Library of History translated by Charles Henry Oldfather.
